alert.note: Alert for St. Charles (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 8:11PM CDT until March 30 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ST. BERNARD...CENTRAL ST. CHARLES...ORLEANS... NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTHWESTERN PLAQUEMINES PARISHES... At 811 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near New Orleans, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Avondale, Marrero, Harvey, East New Orleans, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Metairie, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Lake Catherine, Luling, Poydras, Estelle, Woodmere, Elmwood and Violet. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 232 and 254. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
